Trial_Design.evidence: The patients were randomized into two groups

Participants.evidence: We included 38 patients (40 limbs) undergoing limb lengthening or deformity correction using an external fixator

Intervention.evidence: a polyhexamethylene biguanide group (22 limbs) and a control group (18 limbs)

Objective.evidence: We compared the rate of pin tract infection using plain gauze and gauze impregnated with polyhexamethylene biguanide

Method_Outcome.evidence: The metal-skin interfaces were assessed by a researcher blinded to the type of gauze at 2, 4, 8, and 12 weeks after surgery for the pin site infection

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: The patients were randomized into two groups

Blinding.evidence: assessed by a researcher blinded to the type of gauze

Number_Randomised.evidence: We included 38 patients (40 limbs) undergoing limb lengthening or deformity correction using an external fixator between July 2009 and June 2010

Number_Analysed.evidence: polyhexamethylene biguanide group (n = 1068; 1.0%) than for the control group (n = 864; 4.5%)

Result_Outcome.evidence: the risk for infection was lower (relative risk, 0.228; 95% confidence interval, 0.118, 0.443)
